page.title: 10Christmas Trees
page.content: Yattendon Estates grow an awful lot of Christmas Trees. Every year you can see pictures of them on television. They are dug up by a special machine operated by a team of men who come every year from the island of Sark in the Channel Islands. Then they are fed into another machine operated by some of our Mums which puts a plastic tube over them to stop the branches from spreading. They have to wear gloves to stop the needles from scratching their hands. They start digging in October. Some of the trees are flown all over the world to places like Arabia. There have to be guards in the fields to stop people coming along with lorries and poaching them. The estate gives two trees to the school, a big one for the Juniors and a small one for the Infants.
